If your taxi driver recommends that you go to this "authentic local" restaurant, get out and find another taxi.  They pay taxis to take tourists here where they are very untrustworthy.  It wasn't terrible but the dishonesty left a bad taste in my mouth.  I was willing to overlook the fact that we ordered a small drink and they brought us a large one instead...no big deal and honest mistake right? Nope.  When we arrived they brought a plate of bread with tomato (pan con tomate) which we  moved to he side.  When our entree arrived the waiter came back and shifted some plates on our table and HE PLANTED A HALF EATEN PIECE OF BREAD ON THE PLATE SO HE COULD CHARGE US FOR EATING THE BREAD even though we hadn't touched it.  We saw him do that and asked him what it was and he couldn't lie his way out cuz we saw him do it.  He just grabbed the whole plate and walked away.  Then when the bill came they charged us for he bread!  Don't get me wrong, the bread wasn't expensive and we ironically planned to eat it but the fact that the waiter PLANTED A HALF EATEN PIECE that wasn't ours SO HE COULD CHARGE US FOR IT was so underhanded and a little crazy.  Also we found out the taxi driver was given a commission for taking us there.  Again not a terrible thing however we had plans to go to another restaurant which had much better reviews.  We learned our lesson, go with out gut next time and AVOID THIS PLACE.  It's a shame, they would've made more money from us if they were honest as we had planned to stay for dessert and drinks but after that we just left.
